channel.title: Python struct.pack()/calcsize()
channel.description:
[s]I want to pack a byte followed by a long. My buffer can only contain 9 elements. Why can't I pack them into the buffer?[/s]
[code=python] >>> from struct import * >>> calcsize('qB') 9 >>> calcsize('Bq') 12 [/code] [s]It returns differently. Why is this?
I'm using Python 2.7.3 by the way.[/s]
Already got it. [code=python] >>> calcsize('=Bq') >>> 9 [/code]

item.title: Python struct.pack()/calcsize()
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

I want to pack a byte followed by a long. My buffer can only contain 9 elements. Why can’t I pack them into the buffer?

>>> from struct import *
>>> calcsize('qB')
9
>>> calcsize('Bq')
12

[s]It returns differently. Why is this?

I’m using Python 2.7.3 by the way.[/s]

Already got it.

>>> calcsize('=Bq')
>>> 9

Read full topic
